question: You work for a company. You have seen some information online about a training course that would be useful for your work. Write a letter to your manager.
text: I am writing to inform you about a week-long course that would benefit my work at the Department of Software Development.
It is a seven-day intensive program offered by the State Information Technology and is scheduled to start on the 17th of this month.

The course is on the programming language: Java and I believe it would enhance my potential. I came to know that there are 10 new projects which are in the queue, and if I am updated with the language, I can provide expanded technical expertise.

As the training is full-time, I cannot attend the office during the period. Hence, it would be greatly appreciated if you could avail me of a paid leave till the 26th of this month. I believe my absence would not affect the normal functioning of the department, as most of my colleagues have agreed not to take leave during these days.
I look forward to hearing from you soon,
